text: Boltonia montana (mountain doll's daisy), is a North American species of plants in the sunflower family. It is found only in the east-central part of the United States, in the states of New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Virginia.Biota of North America Program, 2014 county distribution map Boltonia montana is a perennial herb up to 150 cm (60 inches) tall. It has many daisy- like flower heads with pink or lavender ray florets and yellow disc florets.Townsend, John F. & Karaman-Castro, Vesna 2006. Sida 22(2): 874–884, f. 1–2 includes line drawings and color photos ==References== Category:Astereae Category:Flora of the Eastern United States Category:Plants described in 2006
title: Boltonia montana
